longdesc.p: Buttons are coded with standard HTML input elements, then enhanced by jQuery Mobile to make them more attractive and useable on a mobile device.

For ease of styling, the framework automatically converts any input element with a type of submit, reset, or button into a custom styled button - there is no need to add the data-role="button" attribute. However, if needed, you can directly call the plugin on any selector, just like any jQuery plugin:
The widget adds a wrapper div around the input.

In the example below, pre-rendered markup for a is provided. The attribute data-corners="false" is explicitly specified, since the absence of the ui-corner-all class on the wrapper element indicates that the "corners" widget option is to be false.

pre.code: The Button

option.name: corners
option.desc:
Applies the theme button border-radius if set to true.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-corners="false".

option.name: icon
option.desc:
Applies an icon from the icon set.
The .buttonMarkup() documentation contains a reference of all the icons available in the default theme.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-icon="star".

option.name: iconpos
option.desc:
Positions the icon in the . Possible values: left, right, top, bottom, none, notext. The notext value will display an icon-only with no text feedback.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-iconpos="right".

desc.strong: This option is deprecated in 1.4.0 and will be removed in 1.5.0.
desc.p: Applies the theme shadow to the 's icon if set to true.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-iconshadow="true".

option.name: inline
option.desc:
If set to true, this will make the act like an inline so the width is determined by the 's text. By default, this is null (false) so the is full width, regardless of the feedback content. Possible values: true, false.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-inline="true".

option.name: shadow
option.desc:
Applies the drop shadow style to the if set to true.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-shadow="false".

option.name: wrapperClass
option.desc:
Allows you to specify CSS classes to be set on the 's wrapper element.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-wrapper-class="custom-class".
